lenders.name: Daniel Debord
lenders.loan_because: We believe that everyone should have the opportunity for a better life.  The creativity and dedication that GOD has placed in his people around the world is just amazing.  It is our privilege to be a part of something this wonderful.

lenders.name: Narelle
lenders.loan_because:
one of the most important books I have ever read - The end of poverty by Jeffrey Sachs- captures the esence and importance of sustained economic growth and the part that we as individuals can play in this. Participating in Kiva allows me to be a global citizen and enables me as an individual to facilitate and participate in some form of global change.
At the end of the day, I choose to make a personal commitment to do what I can to promote human well being.
It is not a hard decision.
lenders.occupational_info:
My job is to ensure that children are safe in their families, and that they are protected and cared for, both emotionally and physically. 
I work with families to help them enhance their parenting skills so that they can provide care for their children and ensure that they have the skills and knowledge to do so.

lenders.name: Samantha
lenders.loan_because: I know how hard it is to feed and look after a family on minimal funds; however I still consider myself lucky compared to many others in the world and because of that I would like to share whatever I can with those in need.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a stay at home mum to my 5 year old son and I'm currently studying a Bachelor of Education and a Bachelor of Arts degree at university. I enjoy spending my spare time reading, writing and budgeting. I hope to one day write a novel and provide my family with the kind of lifestyle I've always dreamed of.

lenders.name: Luna
lenders.loan_because:
I LOVE this concept! I believe in the connection between all on our planet. By helping even one person, we are lifting the energy for all. I think that empowering someone to build a better life for themselves and their family has an exponential effect... as they become more  self sufficient, they are in a position to help those around them. I like the thought that the impact of my initial loan could have a ripple effect.

In addition to being an artist, I am a software developer in the private sector and I have been exploring ways to direct  my technical creations toward making a difference. Kiva's concept is incredibly inspiring for me!
lenders.occupational_info:
I am a singer/songwriter/photographer/writer/...  an eclectic multimedia artist who creates to please, to heal, to entertain... and to inspire. My intention is to spread a positive, empowering message to as many people as I can reach (the world, if my plan goes well... hey, think big, achieve big ;) 

My goal: to deliver a message of hope in my art and my creations to inspire and energize all to reach for and achieve their higher destiny.

my blog:  www.LunaSees.com

lenders.name: Cameron
lenders.loan_because: the person benefits directly
lenders.occupational_info: security officer in charge of a large communications organisation

lenders.name: Catherine
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a wonderful way to make a big difference for a small cost.

lenders.name: Raj

lenders.name: Dana
lenders.loan_because: People look for a hand up, not a hand out.  Everyone needs help from time to time - this is just my way of giving back to the universe. As the loans get repaid, the money gets sent back out for others so the cycle of change and growth continues.

lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: I simply want to assist others to come to a place of health and security.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an artist and I design many different things including jewelry, paintings and also commercial art such as brochures and web pages.

lenders.name: Stefanie
lenders.loan_because: To share with those less fortunate than myself in an effort to help them become more independent.

lenders.name: Kat
lenders.loan_because: I want to ease the lives of those less fortunate.

lenders.name: Tyler

lenders.occupational_info: I'm a college student athlete in the USA

lenders.name: Bonnie

lenders.name: Anastasia

lenders.occupational_info: We are 10-11 year old girls trying to help our world as best as we can! We have gone from normal community girls to saving the world super heros! We want to help!

lenders.name: The Hurley Nelsons
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we received the most wonderful gift this year of a Kiva Gift Certificate from our dear, dear friends Michael, Nicole, Lauren, and Sophie.  What a wonderful experience learning about all the entrepreneurs we could support with our gift, we finally made a decision to contribute to Edith's farming business, may her loan help her build dreams and comfort many.  Giving is the most wonderful gift, the gift to give is truly powerful!

...to inspire others to loan.

lenders.name: Yvonne English
lenders.loan_because: I believe that entrepreneurship can solve most of the world's problems. lenders.name: Ernie
lenders.loan_because: we are not all lucky enough to be born into a life where we have opportunities.  To help in a small way to those who are trying to create theirs is the minimum we can do.  Well done to Kiva.

lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired and like to research family information.

lenders.loan_because: We have so much,and they have so little.

lenders.name: Denise
lenders.loan_because: I love my life and I feel so fortunate and I want to share so others can make a good life for themselves. I picked my first lender because they are weavers and work with fiber.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired from teaching at a community college. Now I am a home-crafter working with fiber. I spin and dye yarn that I knit and weave. So far I do this for myself and for gifts. I do have plans to sell some of my products at a local farmer's market hoping to off-set some of the costs related to my craft.

Food research & technology

lenders.occupational_info: I work in the gaming industry, ensuring that the company I work for complies with the government regulations for our industry.

lenders.name: Joanne
lenders.loan_because: well, right now I have stopped loaning until Kiva bans cockfighting loans. I am at this time withdrawing my monthly repayments  and investing in such as  www.energyincommon.org . Most of my MF funds are in Oikocredit, and some through MicroPlace.com . My real interests are not just in supporting individuals, but also their communities and the planet. Investing at energyincommon will allow me to make contributions to better health and air in communities, to the expansion of solar solutions, and to the health of the planet. (written some years back now) just made a clean energy loan.(March 2015)

lenders.name: Josef
lenders.loan_because:
I have the financial means to do so with much ease. I remember what It was like for me to stumble around and struggle with money to get started or to just keep it going through lean times. 

Being that I run a business myself helping others make alot of money, Kiva.Org suits my personality and my way of doing business perfectly as I can relate to alot of the business owners here.
lenders.occupational_info: In simple terms: Help several hundred people make alot of money online by social media websites (mostly) online. I make several thousands per month and I use it to grow myself and my team to even greater financial success.

lenders.name: Gail
lenders.occupation: I teach managers to be leaders
lenders.occupational_info: I help people learn to lead and manage others at work

lenders.name: Nick
lenders.loan_because: I like to help people, especially those that need it more than others!

lenders.name: Yvonne
lenders.loan_because: This is a great way to help people directly.
lenders.occupational_info: My husband and I  farm wheat barley and sheep on the Eyre Peninsula in Southern Australia.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: this is just so much the right thing to do. We live in a world of choices and opportunity  in Australia that few people really have. So I can go without 10 cups of coffee to help someone do something that makes a huge difference to their life
lenders.occupational_info: I am teaching english in china

lenders.name: Lord Sundstrom Family
lenders.loan_because: We were given a Kiva gift and now believe it is a tremendous way to participate in bettering our global community.  Kiva inspires the kinds of connections that create peace.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I saw the value of microloans when I lived in South Africa. They are a powerful force for positive change in people's lives. They are also low risk and unlike many charities, every penny I loan gets directly to the person who needs it.

lenders.name: Josh
lenders.loan_because: Kiva entrepreneurs are at the forefront of their society’s growth

lenders.name: Pamela
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate to live my dream. Kiva lets me feel as though I am able to do something direct and concrete for people who need little in order to achieve their personal dreams and goals.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Certified Public Manager and Certified Arborist, and a physicist. I teach for Florida State University as well as for some private companies. I also do management consultation, and I grind stumps for my husband's tree service!

lenders.loan_because: I like to help other people achieve , especially other women. I am honored to be able to help these people realize their dreams and improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired farmer

lenders.name: John and Georgia

lenders.loan_because: it's a small way to extend a  hand to someone across the world who needs it

Ultimately,  the welfare of its citizen will improve as the economy expands from the growth of economic activities.
